author: funnygiulio
content: Hi, everyone, now that blocks are deterministic in time beetwen one another, could we increase GasLimit?

author: funnygiulio
content: Maybe by a good 50% at least

author: funnygiulio
content: If I am not mistaken having two blocks too close to each other was one of the reason GasLimit was not increased for a while

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't believe this was the dominant reason for having a 15M gas target.

author: sky.cactus
content: When this particular topic was brought up, someone almost always countered that "on average" is what matters, because even if you can't process a short block in time, there will eventually be a long block during which you can catch up.

author: sky.cactus
content: IMO, the reason to lower the gas limit (or at least keep it where it is) is because of DB growth rates.

author: funnygiulio
content: It was not the dominant one but I think it was still one of the main points

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, I may be mis-remembering, but I don't think it was a main point of any of the core devs?

author: sky.cactus
content: It was frequently brought up by people wanting to increasing the gas limit, but I don't remember the core devs ever agreeing it was a real problem/roadblock?

author: jochembrouwer
content: We will also need to extend devp2p `eth` to gossip the withdrawals, right?

author: ralexstokes
content: they will not need to be gossiped

author: ralexstokes
content: they can only be validated from the consensus layer so in general the EL will only apply withdrawals coming from the CL via the engine API

author: ralexstokes
content: the one exception is syncing previous blocks and the devp2p protocol will need to be extended to accommodate the extended execution payload/block definition in the EIP

author: ryanleeschneider
content: RE: Shanghai, going forward will forks happen at certain CL slots/epochs or certain EL blocks?

author: timbeiko
content: CLs need to fork on epoch boundaries AIUI, and we _could_ keep using blocks for the EL, but timestamps might be more precise? If we use blocks, then there might be a lag between the CL and EL fork of several slots given missed proposals. Timestamps would make it such that the same/next EL block as the CL slot would activate the fork.
